page.title: 02WIVENHOE 40 YEARS AGO
page.content: On Tuesday 7th May, 1985, Jane and I went to interview Jane's Grandma and Grandad. We wanted to ask them some questions about life in Wivenhoe as it used to be. They told us they had moved into Wivenhoe in 1945. We asked them how Wivenhoe had changed over the years. Jane's Grandad said there were too many houses nowadays. He also said that he liked Wivenhoe better today because it is a wider community. We asked, "What possessions do you have now which you would not have had years ago?" They replied, "Television; also most people have a car and own their own house which they did not do then." We asked Jane's Grandma, "What was the population of Wivenhoe when you first came?"
